verses.verse: Let him <S%H5401>kiss<s%> me with the <S%H5390>kisses<s%> of his <S%H6310>mouth<s%>: for thy <S%H1730>love<s%> is <S%H2896>better<s%> than <S%H3196>wine<s%>. thy: Heb. thy loves

Because of the <S%H7381>savour<s%> of thy <S%H2896>good<s%> <S%H8081>ointments<s%> thy <S%H8034>name<s%> is as <S%H8081>ointment<s%> poured <S%H7324>forth<s%>, therefore do the <S%H5959>virgins<s%> <S%H157>love<s%> thee.

<S%H4900>Draw<s%> me, we will <S%H7323>run<s%> <S%H310>after<s%> thee: the <S%H4428>king<s%> hath <S%H935>brought<s%> me into his <S%H2315>chambers<s%>: we will be <S%H1523>glad<s%> and <S%H8055>rejoice<s%> in thee, we will <S%H2142>remember<s%> thy <S%H1730>love<s%> more than <S%H3196>wine<s%>: the <S%H4339>upright<s%> <S%H157>love<s%> thee. the upright: or, they love thee uprightly

I am <S%H7838>black<s%>, but <S%H5000>comely<s%>, O ye <S%H1323>daughters<s%> of <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%>, as the <S%H168>tents<s%> of <S%H6938>Kedar<s%>, as the <S%H3407>curtains<s%> of <S%H8010>Solomon<s%>.

<S%H7200>Look<s%> not upon me, because I am <S%H7840>black<s%>, because the <S%H8121>sun<s%> hath <S%H7805>looked<s%> upon me: my <S%H517>mother's<s%> <S%H1121>children<s%> were <S%H2787>angry<s%> with me; they <S%H7760>made<s%> me the <S%H5201>keeper<s%> of the <S%H3754>vineyards<s%>; but mine own <S%H3754>vineyard<s%> have I not <S%H5201>kept<s%>.

<S%H5046>Tell<s%> me, O thou whom my <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H157>loveth<s%>, where thou <S%H7462>feedest<s%>, <S%H349>where<s%> thou makest thy flock to <S%H7257>rest<s%> at <S%H6672>noon<s%>: <S%H4100>for<s%> why should I be as one that turneth <S%H5844>aside<s%> by the <S%H5739>flocks<s%> of thy <S%H2270>companions<s%>? as one: or, as one that is veiled

If thou <S%H3045>know<s%> not, O thou <S%H3303>fairest<s%> among <S%H802>women<s%>, go thy way <S%H3318>forth<s%> by the <S%H6119>footsteps<s%> of the <S%H6629>flock<s%>, and <S%H7462>feed<s%> thy <S%H1429>kids<s%> beside the <S%H7462>shepherds'<s%> <S%H4908>tents<s%>.
I have <S%H1819>compared<s%> thee, O my <S%H7474>love<s%>, to a company of <S%H5484>horses<s%> in <S%H6547>Pharaoh's<s%> <S%H7393>chariots<s%>.
Thy <S%H3895>cheeks<s%> are <S%H4998>comely<s%> with <S%H8447>rows<s%> of jewels, thy <S%H6677>neck<s%> with <S%H2737>chains<s%> of gold.
We will <S%H6213>make<s%> thee <S%H8447>borders<s%> of <S%H2091>gold<s%> with <S%H5351>studs<s%> of <S%H3701>silver<s%>.
While the <S%H4428>king<s%> sitteth at his <S%H4524>table<s%>, my <S%H5373>spikenard<s%> sendeth <S%H5414>forth<s%> the <S%H7381>smell<s%> thereof.
A <S%H6872>bundle<s%> of <S%H4753>myrrh<s%> is my <S%H1730>wellbeloved<s%> unto me; he shall <S%H3885>lie<s%> all night betwixt my <S%H7699>breasts<s%>.
My <S%H1730>beloved<s%> is unto me as a <S%H811>cluster<s%> of <S%H3724>camphire<s%> in the <S%H3754>vineyards<s%> of <S%H5872>Engedi<s%>. camphire: or, cypress
Behold, thou art <S%H3303>fair<s%>, my <S%H7474>love<s%>; behold, thou art <S%H3303>fair<s%>; thou hast <S%H3123>doves'<s%> <S%H5869>eyes<s%>. my love: or, my companion
Behold, thou art <S%H3303>fair<s%>, my <S%H1730>beloved<s%>, yea, <S%H5273>pleasant<s%>: also our <S%H6210>bed<s%> is <S%H7488>green<s%>.
The <S%H6982>beams<s%> of our <S%H1004>house<s%> are <S%H730>cedar<s%>, and our <S%H7351>rafters<s%> <S%H7351><s%> of <S%H1266>fir<s%>. rafters: or, galleries
